channel.title: Great Lakes Data Watershed
channel.description: Our Great Lakes water quality data managed, processed and visualized using the VDAB Event Data Watershed.

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: gldwor5_wp
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Our website address is: http://gldw.org.

What personal data we collect and why we collect it

Comments

When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Contact forms

Cookies

If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you have an account and you log in to this site, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Analytics

Who we share your data with

How long we retain your data

If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where we send your data

Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

Your contact information

Additional information

How we protect your data

What data breach procedures we have in place

What third parties we receive data from

What automated decision making and/or profiling we do with user data

Industry regulatory disclosure requirements

item.title: Register a Data Stream
item.dc:creator: gldwor5_wp
item.content:encoded:
We are not registering data streams using this form until after our official launch. Please email us at mapp@gldw.org if you wish to get your data stream started before that time.

Fill out the form below to register a new Data Source with GLDW

Data you push into the Great Lakes Data Watershed becomes an immediate public asset for the government, academics and citizen scientists. Real-time data moving into the watershed can be tested for critical condition with configurable alerts and interventions. You can put data into GLDW directly from your instrument or server running VDABtm or by calling the API's with the key associated with your data stream.

* Required FIelds

item.title: Register a Data Tap
item.dc:creator: markjapp
item.content:encoded:
Your local or cloud VDABtm server can subscribe to real time data updates from GLDW by registering a Data Tap and identifying which data events you are interested in receiving. Streaming data will be pushed to your server as it becomes available.

Please fill out the form below to register a GLDW Data Tap.

* Required FIelds

item.title: Register as a User
item.dc:creator: markjapp
item.content:encoded:
Please fill out the form below if you would like to register a GLDW User.

As a registered user you will be able to declare and register data streams. In addition you will be given a complementary VDAB server which can analyze and alert on any data selected from GLDW allowing you to set up customized alerts and notifications.

* Required Fields

item.title: Register Your Organization
item.dc:creator: markjapp
item.content:encoded:
We are not registering organizations until after our official launch.

Please fill out the form below to register an Organization with GLDW.

While most features of GLDW are available to registered GLDW users, data streams may be alternately associated with an organization.

* Required FIelds

item.title: Great Lakes Data Watershed
item.dc:creator: markjapp
item.content:encoded: The screens below are presented by the actual VDAB cloud servers that manage processing and data flow in the Great Lakes Data-Watershed. Click on the icons to visit all of the servers in the watershed. Try clicking on LakeErie followed by Buoy4327 to see data and alerts.

item.title: GLDW Overview
item.dc:creator: markjapp
item.content:encoded:
The Great Lakes Data WatershedTM is a real-time environmental data repository that is expandable and agile and ready for you or your organization to use.

GLDW is built using VDAB

GLDW is built using the Visual Dataflow Application Builder and is hosted in the cloud in a number of different hierarchical systems mimicking the structure of the Great Lakes watershed.

GLDW Data Hierarchy

The GLDW data hierarchy is modeled after the actual watershed and allows data monitoring and alerting at any appropriate place in the hierarchy.

Register Now

Register yourself and your organization to begin utilizing the GLDW data. All registered users will be given their own VDAB server which allows custom data analysis and alerting. If you register a data stream you will be able to put your real-time data into GLDW.

item.title: Source Processing Servers
item.dc:creator: markjapp
item.content:encoded: A number of servers process incoming data to GLDW. An incoming server can support a single data stream or support general input from a specific protocal such as MQTT or a rest API. If your data stream needs a server request it when you register your datastream.

item.title: GLDW Server Architecture
item.dc:creator: markjapp
item.content:encoded:
Source Servers

The source processing containers preprocess data to ensure it is of good quality before being pulled into the watershed.

Watershed Servers

The watershed processing containers are the main processing highway for approved data and are structured to match the actual features of the Great Lakes watershed. Official alerting rules are managed here.

Mirror Servers

The mirror servers contain all the data pushed into the watershed and are configured to ensure data can be queried efficiently. Two mirrors will be maintained including one implemented in MySQL and a second using MongoDB.

User Servers

Each registered user will be provide their own processing space and can perform customized handling of certain data conditions.

item.title: User Registration Completed
item.dc:creator: markjapp
item.content:encoded:
Your user registration request has been completed.

You will be receiving a user login information in an email sent to the email provided with your registration. Expect this sometime after the official GLDW launch in June 2019.

item.title: Data Stream Registration Completed
item.dc:creator: markjapp
item.content:encoded:
Your data stream registration request has been completed.

You will be receiving your stream id and other information in a email sent to the email address associated with the user. Expect this sometime after the official GLDW launch in June 2019.

item.title: Organization Registration Completed
item.dc:creator: markjapp
item.content:encoded:
Your organization has been registered.

You will be receiving a confirmation email sometime after the official GLDW launch in June 2019.

item.title: GLDW Data Streams
item.dc:creator: mattjapp
item.content:encoded:
[["Source","Label","Quality ","Organization","Description","Links"],["USGSWaterWatch","USGSData","High","United States Geologic Survey","This is data read every 10 minutes from over 500 USGS monitoring stations. The water flow and water levels are read. GLDW Alerts are created for potential flooding conditions. ","USGS WaterWatch"],["LakeErieBuoys","WaterMetrics","Simulated","MJA Technology LLC","This is simulated data demonstrating how data from a series of buoys on Lake Erie could be graphed, analyzed and trigger alerts","Container"],["TDSManual","TDSData","Manual","MJA Technology LLC","This demonstrates how Total Dissolved Solids data that is manually entered can be validated prior to incorporating the data in the VDAB repository.","Container
EntryForm"]]

item.title: Website Enhancement Activites
item.dc:creator: markjapp
item.content:encoded: [["Task","Status","DueDate","Description"],["USGS Map Page","Complete","21-Jul-19","Develop a map page highlighting all USGS Flow data"],["Alerts Widget","Complete","01-Aug-19","Develop a widget that displays current alerts and allows selection of an Alert for more details."],["Alerts Detail Page","Active","01-Aug-19","Develop an alert detail page including a map of the location."],["Alerts List page","Scheduled","15-Aug-19","Develop a page that allows searching and selecting all existing alerts."]]

item.title: Instrument Toolkit Activities
item.dc:creator: markjapp
item.content:encoded: [["Task","Status","DueDate","Description"],["MyWatershedTarget Node","Complete","01-Jul-19","Develop a target node which posts data to the Monitor My Watershed ODM2 Data Portal"],["Wifi Uplink Radio","Complete","01-Jul-19","Develop capabilities to use WiFI as an uplink between the Mayfly and the PI3-VDAB hub"],["Modular VDAB Publisher","Complete","01-Aug-19","Develop a modular publisher library compatible with EnviroDIY modular sensor library."],["Mayfly Source Node","Active","15-Jul-19","Develop an integration node and other components to integrate with and input data from the EnviroDIY Mayfly data logger"],["Mayfly VDAB Sketch","Active","15-Aug-19","Develop a Mayfly sketch optimized to work with the VDAB Control and Source Nodes."],["Integrate Depth Sensor","Active","15-Aug-19","Select, integrate and test a Depth Sensor with the standalone Mayfly Data Logger"],["Electrode Calibration Node","Scheduled","01-Sep-19","Develop a general-purpose node for deriving an analyitical result from a voltage and calibration data."],["4G Radio Support","Proposed","","Develop support for 4G communications form the PI3 hub or integrated monitoring station."],["Mayfly Control Node","Proposed","","Develop a control node for simplifying setup and control of a Mayfly Data Logger"]]

item.title: Server Features Activities
item.dc:creator: markjapp
item.content:encoded: [["Task","Status","DueDate","Description"],["Location Enhancements to Events","Complete","01-Jun-19","Enhance all VDAB events to support GPS location."],["Enhanced Alert Support","Complete","01-Jul-19","Develop enhanced alerting capabilities needed to support Alert locations."],["USGS Service Node","Complete","05-Jul-19","Develop node to read the data from the USGS Water Watch data repository"],["500,000 Event Load Test","Active","01-Aug-19","Complete load and query performance test for 500,000 multi parameter metric events."],["GLOS Buoy Service Node","Active","01-Aug-19","Develop a nde to read the latest Buoy data from the GLOS Buoy System"],["5 Million Event Load Test","Scheduled","01-Sep-19","Complete load and query performance test for 5,000,000 multi parameter metric events."]]

item.title: Enhanced Citizen Data Activities
item.dc:creator: markjapp
item.content:encoded: [["Task","Status","DueDate","Description"],["Trend Analysis Node","Active","15-Aug-19","Develop specialized nodes that signal alerting conditions based on deviation from previous metric patterns"],["Android Citizen Data App","Scheduled","15-Oct-19","Develop an Android citizen data entry applicaton which include images and GPS data."],["Apple Citizen Data App","Proposed","","Develop an Apple citizen data entry applicaton which include images and GPS data."]]
